annotation.spannedText: Attending:[**First Name3 (LF) 1232**] Chief Complaint: gross hematuria

classMention.mentionClass: Attending:[**First Name3 (LF) 1232**] Chief Complaint: gross hematuria

annotation.spannedText: History of Present Illness: The patient is a 75-year-old male who presented initially with gross hematuria, was found to have bladder cancer which was found to be T1 high grade with CIS. He was restaged which showed invasion to the lamina propria but also extensive glandular involvement of the prostate with no stromal invasion. Due to his history, he presented for surgical management. He has been followed by pulmonary for pulmonary fibrosis which previously had shown BOOP in the past on biopsy.

classMention.mentionClass: History of Present Illness: The patient is a 75-year-old male who presented initially with gross hematuria, was found to have bladder cancer which was found to be T1 high grade with CIS. He was restaged which showed invasion to the lamina propria but also extensive glandular involvement of the prostate with no stromal invasion. Due to his history, he presented for surgical management. He has been followed by pulmonary for pulmonary fibrosis which previously had shown BOOP in the past on biopsy.

annotation.spannedText: HISTORY: BOOP. Rule out pulmonary edema.

classMention.mentionClass: HISTORY: BOOP. Rule out pulmonary edema.

annotation.spannedText: IMPRESSION: AP chest compared to [**2158-11-25**] and [**2159-10-17**]: Chronic interstitial pulmonary disease accounts for the bulk of pulmonary abnormalities, but there is slight increase in opacification in the left lower lobe, which could represent pneumonia or aspiration and an increase in the background density of the lungs, which may be a function of differing radiologic technique or mild pulmonary edema. Nevertheless, there is no mediastinal vascular engorgement, appreciable increase in heart size or indication of substantial pleural effusion to suggest congestive heart failure. Nasogastric tube ends in the stomach.

annotation.spannedText: [**Hospital 93**] MEDICAL CONDITION: 75M IPF, s/p radical cystoprostatectomy, ileal loop, POD1 REASON FOR THIS EXAMINATION: pulmonary edema? ***pt will be on [**Hospital Ward Name **] in the afternoon*** HISTORY: Postoperative with shortness of breath suggesting pulmonary edema.

classMention.mentionClass: [**Hospital 93**] MEDICAL CONDITION: 75M IPF, s/p radical cystoprostatectomy, ileal loop, POD1 REASON FOR THIS EXAMINATION: pulmonary edema? ***pt will be on [**Hospital Ward Name **] in the afternoon*** HISTORY: Postoperative with shortness of breath suggesting pulmonary edema.

annotation.spannedText: FINDINGS: In comparison with the study of [**12-10**], the patient has taken a much poorer inspiration. There is again diffuse prominence of interstitial markings consistent with chronic pulmonary disease. Some increasing opacification at the left base may reflect some atelectasis or pneumonia or be a manifestation of bronchiectatic changes from previous inflammatory disease. The right IJ catheter again lies in the upper superior vena cava. The nasogastric tube extends at least to the upper stomach, though it is difficult to follow beyond this point.

classMention.mentionClass: FINDINGS: In comparison with the study of [**12-10**], the patient has taken a much poorer inspiration. There is again diffuse prominence of interstitial markings consistent with chronic pulmonary disease. Some increasing opacification at the left base may reflect some atelectasis or pneumonia or be a manifestation of bronchiectatic changes from previous inflammatory disease. The right IJ catheter again lies in the upper superior vena cava. The nasogastric tube extends at least to the upper stomach, though it is difficult to follow beyond this point.

annotation.spannedText: Brief Hospital Course: GU: Pt admitted postoperatively after prostacystectomy with ileal loop and ileostomy creation. The night of admission, the pt's pain was well controlled with an epidural, and he was monitored in the PACU without any complications. On POD1, the pt was transferred to the floor, where he remained hemodynamically stable with good urine output from the ileostomy, which appeared well vascularized and pink in color. POD1, the pt was bolused on a few occasions for marginal urine output, but by POD2, the pt was making adequate urine without any additional fluids.

classMention.mentionClass: Brief Hospital Course: GU: Pt admitted postoperatively after prostacystectomy with ileal loop and ileostomy creation. The night of admission, the pt's pain was well controlled with an epidural, and he was monitored in the PACU without any complications. On POD1, the pt was transferred to the floor, where he remained hemodynamically stable with good urine output from the ileostomy, which appeared well vascularized and pink in color. POD1, the pt was bolused on a few occasions for marginal urine output, but by POD2, the pt was making adequate urine without any additional fluids.

annotation.spannedText: Pulm: Preop diagnosis of pulmonary fibrosis, so pulmonology was intimately involved in the pt's postoperative plan. POD1, IV fluids were held to keep the pt dry and breathing comfortably. CXRs demonstrated no evidence of CHF or worsening pulmonary processes. By POD1, the pt was weaned to room air while maintaining a saturation of 96%. Intraoperatively, the pt received stress dose steroids, which were weaned over the course of his 6 day hospitalization, on discharge, the pt was transitioned to prednisone 15 mg qd.

classMention.mentionClass: Pulm: Preop diagnosis of pulmonary fibrosis, so pulmonology was intimately involved in the pt's postoperative plan. POD1, IV fluids were held to keep the pt dry and breathing comfortably. CXRs demonstrated no evidence of CHF or worsening pulmonary processes. By POD1, the pt was weaned to room air while maintaining a saturation of 96%. Intraoperatively, the pt received stress dose steroids, which were weaned over the course of his 6 day hospitalization, on discharge, the pt was transitioned to prednisone 15 mg qd.

annotation.spannedText: CV: The pt remained cardiovascularly stable throughout his hospitalization. He received IV lopressor periop and was transitioned to his home dose of atenolol prior to discharge. No episodes of chest pain, palpitations or other cardiac events.
